e699750f-0136-4d63-b8f5-3b0c580767c5.description: The BNY Mellon Enactus Student Fellow badge is earned by those Enactus students who have completed all three phases of the program. These students have strengthen their capacity to create and deploy higher quality projects that have sustainable impact.
e699750f-0136-4d63-b8f5-3b0c580767c5.name: BNY Mellon Enactus Student Fellow

alignments.name: APMG
alignments.description: This credential readies the earner to take the APMG International PMD Pro Level 1 Certification Exam.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete all coursework and assessments related to project management.
Complete all coursework and assessments related to entrepreneurial thinking. This includes coaching and the Gallup BP-10 Entrepreneurial Talents assessment.
Complete all coursework and assessments related to financial skills, mentoring and common sense economics.

85a97127-be37-43c3-8812-395326a668c1.description: This series is a collaboration between Enactus and Robert Half to help fill the gap from COVID-19 by providing students with access to the nationally recognized SkillSoft platform to help gain skills to increase success after graduation.
85a97127-be37-43c3-8812-395326a668c1.name: 2020 Enactus Summer Leadership Series

badge_template_activities.title: Students complete at least one course in the following topics:  Leadership, Business Skills, Finance Skills, Critical Thinking and Emotional Intelligence

117a16ed-c4e8-4de4-8849-5e048568d4c0.description: Awarded to students who complete the BNY Mellon Enactus Student Fellows program. By completing the program, students develop skills in entrepreneurship, leadership, and emotional intelligence.
117a16ed-c4e8-4de4-8849-5e048568d4c0.name: 2020-2021 BNY Mellon Enactus Student Fellows

badge_template_activities.title: Enactus partnered with Gallup and have utilized their Builders Profile 10 Entrepreneurial Talents. Students have completed the following:  personal assessment, modules exploring & interpreting their entrepreneurial talents & a coaching call with Enactus staff to develop individual competency development plan

Students took an interactive course on Budgeting Basics: Managing Project Financials created by Enactus Advisor, Eric Hernandez, CPA, CGMA - Assistant Professor from Taylor University. The course description is: Managing your projects finances is an essential part of its success.  The Budgeting Basics course will take an in-depth look at what factors into your project’s budget including; expenses, fixed costs, variable costs, fundraisers and more.

Students completed the Design for Delight course created by Intuit. Design for Delight is the set of guiding principles for solving that important customer problem. A mindset more than a process, it’s about iterating your way to an answer and making decisions intentionally along the way. Delight is critical because it’s not enough anymore just to meet customer expectations. True innovation is about exceeding those expectations so that customers recommend our products to others.

Students completed the Envisia Performance View 360 assessment. This 70 question assessment measures students: communication skills, task management skills and interpersonal skills. Students were able to nominate raters to take this assessment on their behalf to provide students with a 360 view of their leadership style.

Securing a Job in The Era of Digital Reality course created by Dr. Bonnie J. Covelli,  Assistant Professor & Chair, Graduate and Degree Completion Professional Studies/ Business Incubator from University of St. Francis. The course objectives included topics such as: Applicant Tracking Systems, elements of LinkedIn profiles, the use of social media in the hiring process, interview questions, job offer process, best practices in negotiating and navigating offer process.

ac076301-36c8-41bd-9b65-bd16ea6dd90b.description: Awarded to students who complete the BNY Mellon Enactus Student Fellows program. By completing the program, students develop skills in entrepreneurship, leadership, and emotional intelligence.
ac076301-36c8-41bd-9b65-bd16ea6dd90b.name: 2021-2022 BNY Mellon Enactus Student Fellows

badge_template_activities.title: Enactus partnered with Gallup and have utilized their Builders Profile 10 Entrepreneurial Talents. Students have completed the following: personal assessment, modules exploring & interpreting their entrepreneurial talents & a coaching call with Enactus staff to develop individual competency development plan

Students took an interactive course on Budgeting Basics: Managing Project Financials created by Enactus Advisor, Eric Hernandez, CPA, CGMA - Assistant Professor from Taylor University. The course description is: Managing your projects finances is an essential part of its success. The Budgeting Basics course will take an in-depth look at what factors into your project’s budget including; expenses, fixed costs, variable costs, fundraisers and more.

A mindset more than a process, it’s about iterating your way to an answer and making decisions intentionally along the way. Delight is critical because it’s not enough anymore just to meet customer expectations. True innovation is about exceeding those expectations so that customers recommend our products to others.

Students completed the Envisia Performance View 360 assessment. This 70 question assessment measures students: communication skills, task management skills and interpersonal skills. Students were able to nominate raters to take this assessment on their behalf to provide students with a 360 view of their leadership style.

Securing a Job in The Era of Digital Reality course created by Dr. Bonnie J. Covelli, Assistant Professor & Chair, Graduate and Degree Completion Professional Studies/ Business Incubator from University of St. Francis. The course objectives included topics such as: Applicant Tracking Systems, elements of LinkedIn profiles, the use of social media in the hiring process, interview questions, job offer process, best practices in negotiating and navigating offer process.

Project Management Institute (PMI) KICKOFF is a 45-minute digital course and tool kit that guides students through the basics of project management, so you can effectively launch their project(s) from start to finish. Students also receive a digital badge for completion of this course.

4d1a76d5-452e-4d89-852b-01d9eda4da5a.description: This 5-week student learning opportunity is focused on training & development for Enactus US students using content from sponsor KPMG and an in-kind gift from Robert Half of access to their SkillSoft training . The program culminates in a Pitch Competition where participants demonstrate their leadership learnings.
4d1a76d5-452e-4d89-852b-01d9eda4da5a.name: 2021 Enactus Summer Leadership Series

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the 'Escape Your Brain: KPMG Design Thinking' course. This game-based course, created by KPMG, helps learners explore barriers to creativity and cognitive biases that can hinder decision-making, innovation and problem-solving, and explains the foundational concepts behind KPMG’s Design Thinking for Business  Model Innovation methodology.

Students are required to take two of the following courses focused on Virtual Leadership and Collaboration:  Expert Insights on Managing Virtual Teams, Establishing Effective Virtual Teams, Contributing as a Virtual Team Member, Planning an Effective Presentation, Expert Insights on Presentation Skills

Students are required to take one of the following courses focused on Design Thinking, Problem Solving, & Critical Thinking: Design Thinking for Innovation: Brainstorming and Ideation, Design Thinking for Innovation: Stakeholder Engagement, Getting to the Root of a Problem, Expert Insights on Critical Thinking

Students are required to take one of the following courses focused on Multicultural Communication and Unconscious Bias: Overcoming Your Own Unconscious Biases, Expert Insights on Unconscious Bias, Expert Insights on Managing a Culturally Diverse Team, Using Communication Strategies to Bridge Cultural Divides
Students are required to take one of the following courses focused on Business Skills: Building Your Presentation, Developing an Effective Business Case
Students are required to take one of the following courses focused on Time Management: Managing Your Time So It Doesn’t Manage You,  Expert Insights on Setting and Managing Priorities

Students take what they've learned throughout the courses and randomly be assigned a group. Each group will develop a project pitch in response to challenges relating to SDG 8 (Decent Work and Economic Growth). Teams choose from 4 provided problem statements to focus their solution. Teams have completed a pitch canvas and a 3-minute presentation.

5daa8f5f-7fca-4b5b-8116-d18d9c07a0db.description: The Enactus Entrepreneurial Exchange Participant badge is earned by the Enactus students who have completed the virtual international exchange program with Enactus Morocco. During this 6-week program, students engaged in an entrepreneurial and cultural immersion to learn more about project ideation, implementation, and impact. US Students collaborated and engaged with Enactus Morocco students and together drove a team project pitch to create impact.
5daa8f5f-7fca-4b5b-8116-d18d9c07a0db.name: Enactus Entrepreneurial Exchange Participant 2021-2022

badge_template_activities.title: Student participated in a 6-week series of synchronous and asynchronous learning exercises to develop project ideation, management, and team building skills. Student projects were then showcased in a culminating pitch competition.

dfee085a-db00-4db2-aa27-898fd5426f23.description: Awarded to students who complete the BNY Mellon Enactus Student Fellows program. By completing the program, students develop skills in entrepreneurship, leadership, and emotional intelligence.
dfee085a-db00-4db2-aa27-898fd5426f23.name: 2022-2023 BNY Mellon Enactus Student Fellows
